title: What is the future of STEM Education? - Quora

response.answer_text: With the ever-increasing demand for the STEM subjects, the future really seems very promising and bright. The importance of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Management can be felt in every step of our daily life. STEM jobs are also in high demand every day and are expected to grow exponentially over the coming years. However, due to the shortage of professionally trained STEM tutors, science education in the US has a long way to go. Such a need makes it very important for educators to pursue a course in stem tutoring online and reap the benefits. Proper learning is a must Even though STEM subjects offer prolific careers, not all qualify to attain it. This is because of knowledge gaps and lack of competencies in the relevant subjects. But, well-trained educators can easily solve this problem because they are well-equipped with all the necessary training needed to impart learning in the best way. They can efficiently guide students to gain knowledge in n –in-depth manner and become ready to dive in the professional fields bang on. The right balance of theory and practicals Learning on any subject cannot be considered holistic unless it encompasses both theoretical knowledge and practical understanding equally. Most educational institutions fail to realize this important. But, a well –trained and professional educator in STEM subjects can guide students in the best way with the right balance of both these two important aspects. They can thus help in nurturing students with a scientific bent of mind who are ready to ideate and innovate successfully in the professional realms. Need to match standards It's become a familiar fact that most high school students are often woefully unprepared for careers in STEM subjects. Students in the United States have reportedly regularly scored low on these subjects, which consequently makes it difficult for them to pursue a career in the field. This fact alone emphasizes the importance of preparing students for STEM careers under the guidance of skilled and knowledgeable educators. They are well-aware of the complexities of the subjects and the ways to make those aspects intelligible for students. Thus, under the able guidance and tutoring of trained STEM educators, aspirants can have a successful career in STEM subjects.
